messages.message:
> • Extracting a single data point where you need to provide more context: an example is captured in Taxdown video. What’s our guidance on what users should do this such cases?
Just want to note that this use case is documented. You can enter a short field name, then edit the field and enter a more complex prompt, even with extraction mode selected.

I haven't tried it, but I wonder if this method^ would also work for extracting a clause. The multiple data points (list) and table use cases seem like they would be best addressed with data types.

I might have missed some nuance here, but I thought the main difference between these two modes centers on provenance: extraction mode looks for _actual text_ in the document and returns provenance, and reasoning mode doesn't have that limitation.

It doesn't work well unless you switch to reasoning at this moment. But we will address these with the introduction of data type (user will be able to add additional descriptions when field name doesn't extract value correctly; they will also be able to choose if they want to extract a list, table, or field)
